FuncDef:
The ppp keepalive strict-check magic-number command enables the PPP magic number check function, so that a device compares the magic number in a received Echo Reply packet with that learned during LCP negotiation.
The undo ppp keepalive strict-check magic-number command disables the PPP magic number check function.
By default, the PPP magic number check function is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After a PPPoE user goes online, the device periodically sends Echo Request packets to the client.
To detect whether the user stays online, run the ppp keepalive strict-check magic-number command to enable the PPP magic number check function, so that the device compares the magic number in a received Echo Reply packet with that learned during LCP negotiation. If the two magic numbers are the same, the user is considered online. Otherwise, the user is considered offline.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
